channel.title: Wilderness area help

item.title: Wilderness area help
item.dc:creator: @lugmfr lugmfr
item.description:
@lugmfr wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:2, topic:414148”][quote author=lugmfr link=topic=516108.msg3744793#msg3744793 date=1315667926]

[code]if((absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966) {
return true;
}
return false;
}

[/code]

Theres the inWild code, the coordinates aren’t right but, when I changed them to what i wanted which was a small area of the island of miscillania, wilderness. It made that area wilderness but it also made other areas wilderness too. like rock crabs etc -____- could someone help.
[/quote]

How did you record the X and Y coords?

Bottom left X, top right X && bottom left Y, top right Y? Also, that should of gave you errors because you have two opening brackets (( and one closing bracket ).

For instance, this will work (change accordingly):

public boolean inVarrock() { if(getAbsX() > 3172 && getAbsX() < 3274 && getAbsY() > 3370 && getAbsY() < 3507) { return true; } return false; } [/quote]
I appreciate it.

Read full topic

item.title: Wilderness area help
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“lugmfr, post:1, topic:414148”][code]if((absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966) {
return true;
}
return false;
}

[/code]

Theres the inWild code, the coordinates aren’t right but, when I changed them to what i wanted which was a small area of the island of miscillania, wilderness. It made that area wilderness but it also made other areas wilderness too. like rock crabs etc -____- could someone help.[/quote]

How did you record the X and Y coords?

Bottom left X, top right X && bottom left Y, top right Y? Also, that should of gave you errors because you have two opening brackets (( and one closing bracket ).

For instance, this will work (change accordingly):

public boolean inVarrock() {
		if(getAbsX() > 3172 && getAbsX() < 3274 && getAbsY() > 3370 && getAbsY() < 3507) {	
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}

Read full topic
